title: Nigamananda Paramahansa
summary: Swami Nigamananda Paramahansa (born Nalinikanta Chattopadhyay; 18 August 1880[1] â€“ 29 November 1935[2]) is a Sadguru, yogi, guru and mystic well known in Eastern India.[3][4][5][6] He is associated with the Shakta tradition and viewed as a perfect spiritual master of tantra, gyan, yoga and prema or bhakti.[7][8][9][10][11] His followers idealized him as their worshipped and beloved thakura.
